page.title: 12THE GIANT OF THE MOUNT
page.content: The giant Cormoran lived on St. Michael's Mount. His wife was dead so he had no-one to cook for him. He made the people of Marazion give him a bullock each day to eat. One night a travelling tinker, called Jack, persuaded the men of the village to help him dig a big pit at the bottom of the Mount. Next morning Jack insulted Cormoran, who grew angry and chased him. Cormoran fell into the pit with only his head sticking out and couldn't move. Jack sent for his Aunt Nancy from Gulval, who told the giant that he must learn to behave. She fed him on saffron buns and starry-gazy pasties and at last the giant promised to be good. It took a week to dig him out of the pit. He married Aunt Nancy and lived happily ever after.
